answers1.e: The Object class in Java is the superclass from which all other classes inherit from.
The java.lang.Math.round() function takes the floor of 122.25.
The four most important concepts of OOP are abstraction, polymorphism, inheritance, and encapsulation.
The expression x-- ensures that the condition of the do-while loop, x < 4, always remains true.
The format of a ternary expression is <boolean expression> ? <expression1> : <expression2>.
x++ is a postfix expression which returns the value of 15 before incrementing by 1.
The private access classifier only allows methods to be accessed from the class in which it belongs.
A method is a group of statements that perform an operation.
Strings in Java are written using quotations and not apostrophes.
A package bundles together related interfaces and classes so that the code can be modularized and reused.
An interface contains methods with no implementation, so that classes can implement the methods while still retaining the same method signature.
The mystery function is a recursive function that finds the factorial of the given number. 5! is equal to 120.
Java allows methods in this same class to share names as long as the number or types of parameters differ.
The arr value is pointing to the location of the array. Therefore, printing the value of arr will print out the memory address of the object.
The ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown when an array has been accessed with an illegal index.
JUnit is a unit testing framework that allows you to write repeatable tests for your code.
Since the sum variable is an integer, the added value gets rounded down to the nearest integer.
The final keyword in Java can signify that a class cannot be extended, a method cannot be overridden, or that a field is a constant.
A Runnable is an interface that will be implemented by objects that need to be executed by a thread. The Thread class itself uses the Runnable interface.
Serialization is when the state of an object is converted into a byte stream. The byte stream can then be transferred through a network.

answers2.e: A tuple is an ordered but unchangeable collection.
Negative indices start at -1 from the last element in a list.

The clear method removes all items from a dictionary.
Python allows classes to be instantiated from multiple parent classes.
The extend method adds all elements of an iterable to the end of the list.
The ** operator is used to denote exponents.
An iterable object implements __iter__ which will return an iterator object.
The numbers 2 and 4 are skipped since removing objects from a list shifts their index.
The copy method returns a shallow copy while deepcopy returns a deep copy.
A tuple consisting of {b,a} is created and assigned to a and b.
Picking is a process in which an object is coverted to a string and dumped into a file.
Dictionaries are an unordered, mutable, and indexed collection.
The function recursively adds all the numbers in the array.
The module to write concurrent code is called asyncio.
The __init__ function is used to initialize attributes of a class.
